abstract: Buying an online coupon company could help Google dominate local advertising, but the $6 billion deal worries investors because of its price.
snippet: Buying an online coupon company could help Google dominate local advertising, but the $6 billion deal worries investors because of its price.
lead_paragraph: Google’s $6 billion bid for Groupon, an online coupon start-up, is an aggressive move by the company to dominate local online advertising and help with its long-sought move into social networking.

headline.main: Google Gambit for Groupon Raises Concern

byline.original: By Evelyn M. Rusli and Jenna Wortham

abstract: From “Monkey for a Week” to social media darling, Andrew Mason is now being courted by Google.
snippet: From “Monkey for a Week” to social media darling, Andrew Mason is now being courted by Google.
lead_paragraph: Noah Berger/Bloomberg NewsAndrew Mason, the founder and chief executive of Groupon.

abstract: The online coupon company buys a Silicon Valley marketing start-up and plans to create Groupon sites in Hong Kong, Singapore, the Philippines and Taiwan.
snippet: The online coupon company buys a Silicon Valley marketing start-up and plans to create Groupon sites in Hong Kong, Singapore, the Philippines and Taiwan.
lead_paragraph: 10:29 a.m. | Updated Groupon, the social buying site in talks to be acquired by Google, is getting larger.

headline.main: In Talks With Google, Groupon Goes Shopping Itself

abstract: Google’s long-awaited electronic books project will allow users to buy e-books from it or independent booksellers, and have access to them on Internet-connected devices.
snippet: Google’s long-awaited electronic books project will allow users to buy e-books from it or independent booksellers, and have access to them on Internet-connected devices.
lead_paragraph: Google has finally set a date — or at least a ballpark one — for its long-awaited foray into electronic books, Google Editions.

headline.main: Google Set to Open E-Book Marketplace
